channel.title: BuzzFeed - Raw Feed
channel.description: BuzzFeed, Find Your New Favorite Thing

item.title: 15 Insanely Successful Dropouts
item.description:
No degree? No problem! These dropouts went on to much bigger, much better. Catch Jobs , about the innovator—and yes, dropout—in theaters August 16.

Mark Zuckerberg

Great success: Co-founder and chairman of Facebook.
Dropped out of: Harvard University

Via: Justin Sullivan / Getty Images

Anna Wintour

Great success: Editor-in-chief of Vogue and creative director of Condé Nast.
Dropped out of: North London Collegiate

Via: Clive Brunskill / Getty Images

Edward Albee

Great success: Pulitzer and Tony-winning playwright. Most well-known works include The Sandbox and Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?.
Dropped out of: Trinity College, where he was expelled (also expelled from two high schools)

Via: Hulton Archive / Stringer / Getty Images

Woody Allen

Great success: Prolific writer, director, and comedian.
Dropped out of: New York University (and flunked out of City College)

Via: Andrew H. Walker / Getty Images

View Entire List ›
item.author: TheJobsMovie

media:group.media:description: No degree? No problem! These dropouts went on to much bigger, much better. Catch Jobs, about the innovator--and yes, dropout--in theaters August 16.

media:content.media:description: Great success: Co-founder and chairman of Facebook. Dropped out of: Harvard University
Great success: Editor-in-chief of Vogue and creative director of Condé Nast. Dropped out of: North London Collegiate

Great success: Pulitzer and Tony-winning playwright. Most well-known works include The Sandbox and Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?. Dropped out of: Trinity College, where he was expelled (also expelled from two high schools)
Great success: Prolific writer, director, and comedian. Dropped out of: New York University (and flunked out of City College)

Great success: Singer and actress who has received one or more Academy Awards, Emmy Awards, Golden Globe Awards, Grammy Awards, BAFTAs, People's Choice Awards, Theatre World Awards, Kennedy Center Honors, and Screen Actors Guild Awards. Also she's Mary Poppins. Dropped out of: High school

Great success: An incredibly well-respected comic whose routine "Seven Dirty Words" heavily influenced a 1978 Supreme Court decision that upheld the government's right to censor indecent material on public air. Dropped out of: Catholic high school
Great success: Singer, songwriter, model, and former First Lady of France. Dropped out of: University of Paris
Great success: Author of The Great Gatsby, coiner of the term "Jazz Age." Dropped out of: Princeton University

Great success: Writer, director, and actor. Two times, he was nominated for Academy Awards as producer, director, writer, and actor all on the same film: once for Reds, and once more for Heaven Can Wait. Dropped out of: Northwestern University
Great success: She's Madonna. Dropped out of: University of Michigan
Great success: Founder and chairman of Virgin Group (which includes Virgin Air and Virgin Records), eccentric billionaire. Dropped out of: Boarding school
Great success: Founder of fashion and lifestyle brand Polo Ralph Lauren. Dropped out of: Baruch College
Great success: Founder of KFC. Dropped out of: Elementary school
Great success: Co-founder, chairman, and one time CEO of Microsoft. Dropped out of: Harvard
Great success: Co-founder and CEO of Apple Inc., co-founder of Pixar. Dropped out of: Reed College

item.title: FLESH WOUND
item.description:
“‘Tis but a scratch”…”It’s just a flesh wound!”…Our second design this week is inspired by the Black Knight from the movie Monty Python and the Holy Grail…”Running away, eh? You yellow bastards! Come back here and take what’s coming to ya! I’ll bite your legs off!”

item.title: COLD SLITHER
item.description:
Cold Slither band tour shirt. Remember that awesome G.I. Joe episode?…The G.I. Joe team raids Cobra’s secret vault and thus very nearly bankrupts the evil organization. In a desperate attempt to keep Cobra functioning and solvent, Cobra Commander “packages” Zartan and the Dreadnoks as a heavy metal band called “Cold Slither” and turns them loose as Pied Pipers on America’s youth. The Dreadnoks portrayed the band members and lip-synced a song (penned by the multi-talented Destro) containing subliminal messages. Upon hearing it, the listeners, including G.I. Joe team members Breaker, Shipwreck, and Footloose, were under Cobra’s power. Like much of G.I. Joe’s stock background music, it was recycled for The Transformers, minus the lyrics, serving as one of two generic source music tracks during the cartoon’s run.

Cold Slither band tour shirt. Remember that awesome G.I. Joe episode?...The G.I. Joe team raids Cobra's secret vault and thus very nearly bankrupts the evil organization. In a desperate attempt to keep Cobra functioning and solvent, Cobra Commander "packages" Zartan and the Dreadnoks as a heavy metal band called "Cold Slither" and turns them loose as Pied Pipers on America's youth. The Dreadnoks portrayed the band members and lip-synced a song (penned by the multi-talented Destro) containing subliminal messages. Upon hearing it, the listeners, including G.I. Joe team members Breaker, Shipwreck, and Footloose, were under Cobra's power. Like much of G.I. Joe's stock background music, it was recycled for The Transformers, minus the lyrics, serving as one of two generic source music tracks during the cartoon's run.
item.author: catsdeaddetailsl

media:content.media:description: Cold Slither band tour shirt. Remember that awesome G.I. Joe episode?...The G.I. Joe team raids Cobra's secret vault and thus very nearly bankrupts the evil organization. In a desperate attempt to keep Cobra functioning and solvent, Cobra Commander "packages" Zartan and the Dreadnoks as a heavy metal band called "Cold Slither" and turns them loose as Pied Pipers on America's youth. The Dreadnoks portrayed the band members and lip-synced a song (penned by the multi-talented Destro) containing subliminal messages. Upon hearing it, the listeners, including G.I. Joe team members Breaker, Shipwreck, and Footloose, were under Cobra's power. Like much of G.I. Joe's stock background music, it was recycled for The Transformers, minus the lyrics, serving as one of two generic source music tracks during the cartoon's run.

item.title: The Day Of The Dead In 17 Artistic Images
item.description:
The Day Of The Dead is not only a fun holiday, it also inspires imaginative art and installations. Enjoy the colorful world of sugar skulls with the delicious Jarritos .

Mexican Sugar Skull Painting by Renee Keith

Via: Renee Keith / Getty Images

Mixed media oil painting by Renee Keith

Via: Renee Keith / Getty Images

Sand tapestries (Tapetes de Areña) of skulls and skeletons

Via: John & Lisa Merrill / Getty Images

These 'carpets' are made from sand, dyed sawdust, seeds, flower petals and powdered lime.

Via: John & Lisa Merrill / Getty Images

View Entire List ›
item.author: Jarritos

media:group.media:description: The Day Of The Dead is not only a fun holiday, it also inspires imaginative art and installations. Enjoy the colorful world of sugar skulls with the delicious Jarritos.

media:content.media:description: The photographer Robert Couse-Baker states, "Las calacas are figures of skulls or skeletons commonly used for decoration during the Mexican Day of the Dead festival. This is a shopfront window of Zanzibar Tribal Arts, a fair trade store located in Midtown Sacramento."
You can buy this vase on Etsy here.

item.title: 10 Signs You Were A Hostess Kid Growing Up
item.description:
Who knew that little delicious cakes could have such an impact on your childhood? Time to take a trip down memory lane and relive your childhood memories now that Hostess is making the sweetest comeback ever!

You still want Twinkie The Kid to be your playground buddy.

Via: youtube.com

And you still believe only kids see King Ding Dong.

Parents just didn't understand...

Via: youtube.com

To this day, you still have to heat up your Honey Bun.

Your parents knew the way to your heart, so why mess with tradition?

Source: patrick reynolds  /  via: instagram.com

Everything about this Hostess commercial made your realize that being a kid was awesome.

Via: youtube.com

View Entire List ›
item.author: Hostess

media:group.media:description: Who knew that little delicious cakes could have such an impact on your childhood? Time to take a trip down memory lane and relive your childhood memories now that Hostess is making the sweetest comeback ever!

media:content.media:description: Parents just didn't understand...
Your parents knew the way to your heart, so why mess with tradition?
CupCake yo-yo always beat a "regular" yo-yo any day...no questions about it.
You liked the Twinkie, and they put a ring on it. It was meant to be.
Remember, if you brought one Ho Ho into class, you needed to bring one for everyone else. This just made things way easier for yourself.
They're just a little confused, that's all.
Parents didn't make it to the store? Not an issue at all.

item.title: Horrific Bus Crash In Italy Leaves At Least 38 Dead
item.description:
It is not immediately clear why the bus driver lost control of the vehicle.

Authorities on Monday were investigating why a driver lost control of a bus carrying Italian tourists, crashed through the side wall of a highway bridge, and plunged into a ravine. At least 38 people were killed in the accident.

The bus was carrying a group of tourists from the town of Pozzuoli, on the coast east of Naples.

Via: ITN

It was one of the worst road accidents in Italy's history, Reuters reported, and the second transportation disaster to hit southern Europe in the space of five days.

Via: AFP/Getty Images

Italy's Prime Minister Enrico Letta described the crash as a "dramatic moment" for his entire country.

Rescuers prepared the coffins for the victims.

Via: AFP/Getty Images

Destroyed passenger seats in the wreckage.

Via: AFP/Getty Images/Albert Pizzoli

View Entire List ›
item.author: Lisa Tozzi

media:group.media:description: It is not immediately clear why the bus driver lost control of the vehicle.

media:content.media:description: The bus was carrying a group of tourists from the town of Pozzuoli, on the coast east of Naples.
<small>Rescuers prepared the coffins for the victims.</small>
<small>Destroyed passenger seats in the wreckage.</small>
<small>A crucifix is next to the wreckage of the bus crash.</small>

item.title: 17 Types Of People You Meet On The Night Bus
item.description:
Oh, London. You’re so gross at night.

The men wearing fancy dress.

These men may look annoying but they have their uses. Yes, they sing Grease hits out of tune and shout lewd remarks, but they have an infinite supply of Red Stripe with them. And they'll definitely share.

Source: i.imgur.com

The woman who has inexplicably decided to take a screaming baby on a busy form of public transport at 3am.

Source: images.wikia.com

The drunken proposer.

Your eyes. It's your eyes he's fallen in love with. But, in a way, you've got to admire this man. If you don't ask...

Source: cdn.uproxx.com

The Christian who just wants to make sure you're keeping hydrated.

Why do religious people always give drunk girls water? Who cares? When it's 3am, you've just stumbled out of the Roxy and you're sweating Apple VK from every pore of your skin, water tastes like the sweetest nectar. Even if you do have to talk about your sins as you sip.

Source: churchleaders.com

View Entire List ›
item.author: Tabatha Leggett

media:content.media:description: Oh, London. You're so gross at night.

item.title: Like His Birthday But Better: Kim Jong-Un Montage Caps Off North Korean War Anniversary Celebrations
item.description:
Celebrations in Pyongyang continued on Sunday honoring the anniversary of the end of the Korean war with fireworks, synchronized dancing and a movie montage of Kim Jong-Un’s reign. Saturday marked the 60th year since the end of what is known as the “Victorious Fatherland Liberation War” in the north.

Follow NowThis News on Facebook and Twitter.
The NowThis News app is live -- and it's FREE! Download it.

media:group.media:description: Celebrations in Pyongyang continued on Sunday honoring the anniversary of the end of the Korean war with fireworks, synchronized dancing and a movie montage of Kim Jong-Un's reign. item.title: 10 Maine Made Goods You Don’t Have To Go To Maine For
item.description:
Maine artists and craftsmen are renowned for the quality of their handmade goods. Maybe it’s something in the air up there, maybe it’s because there isn’t a ton to do and making stuff is fun. Whatever the reason these makers ship, so you won’t have to go to almost Canada to enjoy their work!

Natural White Birch Forest Wood Clock

Via: etsy.com

Birch Tree Pillow

Via: etsy.com

Driftwood Starburst Mirror

Via: etsy.com

Ron Swanson Paper Art Print

Via: etsy.com

View Entire List ›
item.author: PaperGirl

media:content.media:description: Maine artists and craftsmen are renowned for the quality of their handmade goods. Maybe it’s something in the air up there, maybe it’s because there isn’t a ton to do and making stuff is fun. Whatever the reason these makers ship, so you won’t have to go to almost Canada to enjoy their work!
